themes.name: Creative Team Leads
representativeQuotes: So I think Casey, who's like a creative director, has real, he's very talented as it relates to film.
He's kind of like a senior associate or manager level person that does a lot of, like, the creative.
And what I really value about him is he's kind of like a pixel-perfect designer, sort of like a Cobb-type person, but they do a ton of grunt work, and I think he's got sort of an engineering mindset.

themes.name: Process Automation Need
representativeQuotes: So how do you deal with the entitled superstars that don't think they need to do anything different in a world where that tip of the spear is really valuable because all of the long-tail stuff are the things that are getting automated and commoditized.
And if a lot of what you accomplish through email and meetings and video calls and all of that stuff can be structured and automated, and your time is spent.
So he's more around, like, how, you know, how you get to a point where the majority of your code is written by AI and is being checked by AI and workflows related to that.

themes.name: Leadership Aligned

executiveSummary: Based on analysis of 9 C-suite interviews, GlueIQ demonstrates emerging AI adoption with significant gaps between leadership aspiration and operational reality. Overall AI maturity score: 0.7/10. Key themes include: creative team leads, process automation need, leadership aligned. Strongest dimension: leadership vision (2/10). Weakest dimension: skills talent (-1/10). Identified AI champions () can serve as change agents. Immediate priorities: formalize AI strategy, establish governance, and targeted upskilling.
